subject: Study Notes - European History Exam Next Week
text: Compiled study notes for the European History midterm covering 1500-1800. Key topics to memorize: RENAISSANCE (1400-1600): Started in Italy, emphasis on humanism, classical learning revival. Important figures: Leonardo da Vinci, Michelangelo, Machiavelli (The Prince). REFORMATION (1517-1648): Martin Luther's 95 Theses in 1517, Protestant split from Catholic Church, Peace of Augsburg 1555, Thirty Years' War ended with Peace of Westphalia 1648. AGE OF EXPLORATION (1450-1650): Columbus 1492, Vasco da Gama reached India 1498, Magellan circumnavigation 1519-1522. Causes: desire for trade routes, spread of Christianity, technological advances (compass, caravel ships). ABSOLUTISM (1600-1789): Divine right of kings, Louis XIV of France "L'Ã©tat, c'est moi", Palace of Versailles as symbol of absolute power. England exception with constitutional monarchy after Glorious Revolution 1688. ENLIGHTENMENT (1685-1815): Reason and science emphasized, key philosophers: John Locke (natural rights, social contract), Voltaire (freedom of speech), Rousseau (general will), Montesquieu (separation of powers). Influenced American and French Revolutions. Professor said to focus on cause-and-effect relationships and be ready to write essay comparing absolutism vs. Enlightenment ideals. Memorize dates for major events - she always includes timeline matching section worth 25 points!
